intro: Meiogyne subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are used as a starch source. The plant has arrowhead-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in an inflorescence. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its medicinal and nutritional properties, it has been historically valued in traditional medicine.
